body: @dependabot rebase
Looks like org.webjars:font-awesome is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
Looks like org.webjars:font-awesome is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
@dependabot rebase
Looks like org.webjars.npm:pdfjs-dist is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
@dependabot rebase
Looks like org.webjars.npm:pdfjs-dist is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
Hi @wallsarsh, can you perhaps make a PR against the `master` branch instead?

Wrong target branch, merging this would not have any effect on upcoming releases. -> closing

However, thanks for reporting anyway. I'll fix the typos in branches `master` and `v3`.
Hi Alf, can you perhaps rebase your PR. I don't want to merge your changes to `AuthorizorShiro`.
Now only the pom is updated, when adding a classifier a version is needed too, but I'm not a maven expert ....
It could also be enough to add the classifier to the shiro dependencies in the `dependencyManagement` section in `bom/pom.xml`, but I didn't tested it.

I'll merge this PR. However, be aware: artifacts under the /retired/ folder are no longer part of the 3.x releases. And I don't think we'll reinstate those. But you can copy them to your own projects and maintain your own versions.
Superseded by #2816.
Superseded by #2820.

Hi @adoroszlai, thanks for that! I will merge. 

(If branch `v3` has the same technical dept, I'll do that there as well.)
Thanks @andi-huber for reviewing and merging this.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
